channel.description: Recent content in Ethical Hacking on Gourav Dhar | Software Dev, Blogger, Hacker | IIT Roorkee '19

item.title: How I created an undetectable Backdoor for Windows - Ethical Hacking | By Gourav Dhar
item.description: What is a Backdoor ? Backdoor is a method of secretly gaining remote access to a computer by bypassing the normal authentication and firewall of the machine.

item.title: How I created a Trojan Malware - Ethical Hacking | By Gourav Dhar
item.description: A Trojan horse (or Trojan) is one of the most common and dangerous types of threats that can infect your computer or mobile device.

item.title: Spoofing file extensions - Ethical Hacking | By Gourav Dhar
item.description: File extension spoofing is a handy trick when creating trojans. In this blog, I will be spoofing the ‘.

item.title: Information Gathering - Hacking | Gourav Dhar
item.description: Hacking a website? Don’t miss out on this important step!

item.title: How to securely browse the Internet | Prevent data leaks while connecting to public WiFi networks | Gourav Dhar
item.description: Feeling insecure while browsing on public WiFi? This blog is for you.

item.title: Man in the Middle Attacks by ARP Spoofing | Gourav Dhar
item.description: What is Man in The Middle (MITM) Attack? A man in the middle (MITM) attack is a general term for when a machine positions itself in between a connection between a client/user and the server/internet — either to eavesdrop or to impersonate one of the parties, making it appear as if a normal exchange of information is underway.

item.title: Hack WiFi Passwords | Gourav Dhar
item.description: Almost all modern-day wifi routers use WPA2 encryption. The WEP connections or WPS-enabled networks were easier to hack into because of the flaws in their design.

item.title: How to change MAC Address? | Gourav Dhar
item.description: MAC Address stands for Media Access Control. It is a unique address specific to a device set by the device manufacturer.
